TEXT.English: Krovki Skyporill
TEXT.French: Krovki Skyporill
TEXT.German: Krovki Skyporill
TEXT.Italian: Krovki Skyporill
TEXT.Spanish: Krovki Skyporill

TEXT.English: When you see the black eyes,[NEWLINE]Even if you don't wan't to, you will fall in sadness,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength, [NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray,[NEWLINE]Last night, a challenge was made, [NEWLINE]The Death does not wait, hurries the life,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength,[NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray.
TEXT.French: Lorsque vous verrez les yeux noirs,[NEWLINE]Même sans le vouloir, vous serez empli de tristesse,[NEWLINE]Si vous n'avez plus de vigueur,[NEWLINE]Contentez-vous de prier en paix,[NEWLINE]La nuit passée, un défi a été lancé,[NEWLINE]La Mort n'attend pas, elle précipite la vie,[NEWLINE]Si vous n'avez plus de vigueur,[NEWLINE]Contentez-vous de prier en paix.
TEXT.German: When you see the black eyes,[NEWLINE]Even if you don't wan't to, you will fall in sadness,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength, [NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray,[NEWLINE]Last night, a challenge was made, [NEWLINE]The Death does not wait, hurries the life,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength,[NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray.
TEXT.Italian: When you see the black eyes,[NEWLINE]Even if you don't wan't to, you will fall in sadness,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength, [NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray,[NEWLINE]Last night, a challenge was made, [NEWLINE]The Death does not wait, hurries the life,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength,[NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray.
TEXT.Spanish: When you see the black eyes,[NEWLINE]Even if you don't wan't to, you will fall in sadness,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength, [NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray,[NEWLINE]Last night, a challenge was made, [NEWLINE]The Death does not wait, hurries the life,[NEWLINE]If you don't have strength,[NEWLINE]Simply, quietly pray.

TEXT.English: Silwarin Bormil
TEXT.French: Silwarin Bormil
TEXT.German: Silwarin Bormil
TEXT.Italian: Silwarin Bormil
TEXT.Spanish: Silwarin Bormil

TEXT.English: You ain't never had a friend like me!
TEXT.French: Vous avez jamais eu un ami comme moi !
TEXT.German: You ain't never had a friend like me!
TEXT.Italian: You ain't never had a friend like me!
TEXT.Spanish: You ain't never had a friend like me!

TEXT.English: Barsrin Berbincd
TEXT.French: Barsrin Berbincd
TEXT.German: Barsrin Berbincd
TEXT.Italian: Barsrin Berbincd
TEXT.Spanish: Barsrin Berbincd

TEXT.English: But every night, when it gets dark, and the stars come out, I'll look up on her behalf. I'll look up at the sky, and think of you.
TEXT.French: Mais toutes les nuits, quand le ciel s'assombrit et que les étoiles apparaissent, je lèverai les yeux en son nom. Je regarderai le ciel et je penserai à toi.
TEXT.German: But every night, when it gets dark, and the stars come out, I'll look up on her behalf. I'll look up at the sky, and think of you.
TEXT.Italian: But every night, when it gets dark, and the stars come out, I'll look up on her behalf. I'll look up at the sky, and think of you.
TEXT.Spanish: But every night, when it gets dark, and the stars come out, I'll look up on her behalf. I'll look up at the sky, and think of you.

TEXT.English: Wataru Satoi
TEXT.French: Wataru Satoi
TEXT.German: Wataru Satoi
TEXT.Italian: Wataru Satoi
TEXT.Spanish: Wataru Satoi

TEXT.English: Doing what everybody else does, going where most are settling is pointless. It'll only paint rivers a bloody red.[NEWLINE] Innovating, Exploring, Creating,[NEWLINE] Here is what we shall do[NEWLINE] Let us sail a Blue Ocean!
TEXT.French: Agir comme tous les autres, aller là où les autres s'installent, ça n'a aucun sens. Ça va just ensanglanter les rivières.[NEWLINE]Innover, Explorer, Créer, Voilà ce que nous allons faire ![NEWLINE]Allons naviguer sur l'océan bleu !
TEXT.German: Doing what everybody else does, going where most are settling is pointless. It'll only paint rivers a bloody red.[NEWLINE] Innovating, Exploring, Creating,[NEWLINE] Here is what we shall do[NEWLINE] Let us sail a Blue Ocean!
TEXT.Italian: Doing what everybody else does, going where most are settling is pointless. It'll only paint rivers a bloody red.[NEWLINE] Innovating, Exploring, Creating,[NEWLINE] Here is what we shall do[NEWLINE] Let us sail a Blue Ocean!
TEXT.Spanish: Doing what everybody else does, going where most are settling is pointless. It'll only paint rivers a bloody red.[NEWLINE] Innovating, Exploring, Creating,[NEWLINE] Here is what we shall do[NEWLINE] Let us sail a Blue Ocean!

TEXT.English: Rinack Namil
TEXT.French: Rinack Namil
TEXT.German: Rinack Namil
TEXT.Italian: Rinack Namil
TEXT.Spanish: Rinack Namil

TEXT.English: Asphodel and wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is known as the Draught of Living Death.[NEWLINE] A bezoar is a stone taken from the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons.[NEWLINE] As for monkshood and wolfsbane, they are the same plant, which also goes by the name of aconite.[NEWLINE]Well? Why aren't you all copying that down?
TEXT.French: Sachez que le mélange d'asphodèle et d'armoise donne un somnifère si puissant qu'on l'appelle la Goutte du Mort vivant.[NEWLINE]Un bézoard est une pierre qu'on trouve dans l'estomac des chèvres et qui constitue un antidote à la plupart des poisons.[NEWLINE]Quant au napel et au tue-loup, il s'agit de la même plante que l'on connaît aussi sous le nom d'aconit.[NEWLINE]Alors ? Qu'est-ce que vous attendez pour prendre note ?
TEXT.German: Asphodel and wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is known as the Draught of Living Death.[NEWLINE] A bezoar is a stone taken from the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons.[NEWLINE] As for monkshood and wolfsbane, they are the same plant, which also goes by the name of aconite.[NEWLINE]Well? Why aren't you all copying that down?
TEXT.Italian: Asphodel and wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is known as the Draught of Living Death.[NEWLINE] A bezoar is a stone taken from the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons.[NEWLINE] As for monkshood and wolfsbane, they are the same plant, which also goes by the name of aconite.[NEWLINE]Well? Why aren't you all copying that down?
TEXT.Spanish: Asphodel and wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is known as the Draught of Living Death.[NEWLINE] A bezoar is a stone taken from the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons.[NEWLINE] As for monkshood and wolfsbane, they are the same plant, which also goes by the name of aconite.[NEWLINE]Well? Why aren't you all copying that down?

TEXT.English: Vicar Solg Nars
TEXT.French: Vicaire Solg Nars
TEXT.German: Vicar Solg Nars
TEXT.Italian: Vicar Solg Nars
TEXT.Spanish: Vicar Solg Nars

TEXT.English: I come to this world to learn, not to preach. Well, sometimes to preach, but I can control it. But what I got out there is a bunch of people don't much wanna talk about anything. Your captain's a particularly tight-lipped fellow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vicar Nars, on a Lanun transport ship to Golden Leane [NEWLINE]
TEXT.French: I come to this world to learn, not to preach. Well, sometimes to preach, but I can control it. But what I got out there is a bunch of people don't much wanna talk about anything. Your captain's a particularly tight-lipped fellow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vicar Nars, on a Lanun transport ship to Golden Leane [NEWLINE]
TEXT.German: I come to this world to learn, not to preach. Well, sometimes to preach, but I can control it. But what I got out there is a bunch of people don't much wanna talk about anything. Your captain's a particularly tight-lipped fellow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vicar Nars, on a Lanun transport ship to Golden Leane [NEWLINE]
TEXT.Italian: I come to this world to learn, not to preach. Well, sometimes to preach, but I can control it. But what I got out there is a bunch of people don't much wanna talk about anything. Your captain's a particularly tight-lipped fellow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vicar Nars, on a Lanun transport ship to Golden Leane [NEWLINE]
TEXT.Spanish: I come to this world to learn, not to preach. Well, sometimes to preach, but I can control it. But what I got out there is a bunch of people don't much wanna talk about anything. Your captain's a particularly tight-lipped fellow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vicar Nars, on a Lanun transport ship to Golden Leane [NEWLINE]

TEXT.English: Vurbhan Goter
TEXT.French: Vurbhan Goter
TEXT.German: Vurbhan Goter
TEXT.Italian: Vurbhan Goter
TEXT.Spanish: Vurbhan Goter

TEXT.English: What is the art of the con? To con an ordinary citizen? Ah, no, that's too easy.[NEWLINE]The true art of the con is to con another con. And some of the biggest tricksters on the planet are in those buildings.[NEWLINE]They don't care if they cheat some widow out of her pension, or a family man loses his savings.[NEWLINE]It's all the same to them, you know.[NEWLINE] Don't you think that they deserve a taste of their own medicine? [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vurbhan, a few days before the sudden closure of Khazak's National Bank.
TEXT.French: What is the art of the con? To con an ordinary citizen? Ah, no, that's too easy.[NEWLINE]The true art of the con is to con another con. And some of the biggest tricksters on the planet are in those buildings.[NEWLINE]They don't care if they cheat some widow out of her pension, or a family man loses his savings.[NEWLINE]It's all the same to them, you know.[NEWLINE] Don't you think that they deserve a taste of their own medicine? [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vurbhan, a few days before the sudden closure of Khazak's National Bank.
TEXT.German: What is the art of the con? To con an ordinary citizen? Ah, no, that's too easy.[NEWLINE]The true art of the con is to con another con. And some of the biggest tricksters on the planet are in those buildings.[NEWLINE]They don't care if they cheat some widow out of her pension, or a family man loses his savings.[NEWLINE]It's all the same to them, you know.[NEWLINE] Don't you think that they deserve a taste of their own medicine? [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vurbhan, a few days before the sudden closure of Khazak's National Bank.
TEXT.Italian: What is the art of the con? To con an ordinary citizen? Ah, no, that's too easy.[NEWLINE]The true art of the con is to con another con. And some of the biggest tricksters on the planet are in those buildings.[NEWLINE]They don't care if they cheat some widow out of her pension, or a family man loses his savings.[NEWLINE]It's all the same to them, you know.[NEWLINE] Don't you think that they deserve a taste of their own medicine? [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vurbhan, a few days before the sudden closure of Khazak's National Bank.
TEXT.Spanish: What is the art of the con? To con an ordinary citizen? Ah, no, that's too easy.[NEWLINE]The true art of the con is to con another con. And some of the biggest tricksters on the planet are in those buildings.[NEWLINE]They don't care if they cheat some widow out of her pension, or a family man loses his savings.[NEWLINE]It's all the same to them, you know.[NEWLINE] Don't you think that they deserve a taste of their own medicine? [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Vurbhan, a few days before the sudden closure of Khazak's National Bank.

TEXT.English: General Rheis Farceir
TEXT.French: Générale Rheis Farceir
TEXT.German: General Rheis Farceir
TEXT.Italian: General Rheis Farceir
TEXT.Spanish: General Rheis Farceir

TEXT.English: Hope is not lost today. It is found.
TEXT.French: En ce jour, nous ne perdons pas espoir. Nous le trouvons.
TEXT.German: Hope is not lost today. It is found.
TEXT.Italian: Hope is not lost today. It is found.
TEXT.Spanish: Hope is not lost today. It is found.

TEXT.English: Doctor Thurjhon
TEXT.French: Docteur Thurjhon
TEXT.German: Doctor Thurjhon
TEXT.Italian: Doctor Thurjhon
TEXT.Spanish: Doctor Thurjhon

TEXT.English: What I did, I did without choice.[NEWLINE]In the name of peace and sanity.
TEXT.French: Ce que j'ai fait, je l'ai fait sans avoir le choix.[NEWLINE]Au nom de la paix et de la santé mentale.
TEXT.German: What I did, I did without choice.[NEWLINE]In the name of peace and sanity.
TEXT.Italian: What I did, I did without choice.[NEWLINE]In the name of peace and sanity.
TEXT.Spanish: What I did, I did without choice.[NEWLINE]In the name of peace and sanity.

TEXT.English: Doctor Wejrepen Ot
TEXT.French: Docteur Wejrepen Ot
TEXT.German: Doctor Wejrepen Ot
TEXT.Italian: Doctor Wejrepen Ot
TEXT.Spanish: Doctor Wejrepen Ot

TEXT.English: When you get back, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody'll want to hear about your adventures.[NEWLINE]So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamourise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.[NEWLINE]Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning. Like Maro, Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear.[NEWLINE] Otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.
TEXT.French: When you get back, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody'll want to hear about your adventures.[NEWLINE]So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamourise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.[NEWLINE]Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning. Like Maro, Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear.[NEWLINE] Otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.
TEXT.German: When you get back, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody'll want to hear about your adventures.[NEWLINE]So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamourise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.[NEWLINE]Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning. Like Maro, Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear.[NEWLINE] Otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.
TEXT.Italian: When you get back, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody'll want to hear about your adventures.[NEWLINE]So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamourise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.[NEWLINE]Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning. Like Maro, Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear.[NEWLINE] Otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.
TEXT.Spanish: When you get back, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody'll want to hear about your adventures.[NEWLINE]So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamourise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.[NEWLINE]Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning. Like Maro, Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear.[NEWLINE] Otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.

TEXT.English: Doctor Togruith Kapcortn
TEXT.French: Docteur Togruith Kapcortn
TEXT.German: Doctor Togruith Kapcortn
TEXT.Italian: Doctor Togruith Kapcortn
TEXT.Spanish: Doctor Togruith Kapcortn

TEXT.English: There are some corners of the universe which have bred the most terrible things.[NEWLINE] Things which act against everything we believe in.[NEWLINE] They must be fought.
TEXT.French: L'univers possède des recoins sombres qui ont engendré les choses les plus terribles qu'on puisse imaginer.[NEWLINE]Des choses qui vont à l'encontre de tout ce en quoi nous croyons.[NEWLINE]Elles doivent être combattues.
TEXT.German: There are some corners of the universe which have bred the most terrible things.[NEWLINE] Things which act against everything we believe in.[NEWLINE] They must be fought.
TEXT.Italian: There are some corners of the universe which have bred the most terrible things.[NEWLINE] Things which act against everything we believe in.[NEWLINE] They must be fought.
TEXT.Spanish: There are some corners of the universe which have bred the most terrible things.[NEWLINE] Things which act against everything we believe in.[NEWLINE] They must be fought.

TEXT.English: Doctor Lanelith Rillmaw
TEXT.French: Docteur Lanelith Rillmaw
TEXT.German: Doctor Lanelith Rillmaw
TEXT.Italian: Doctor Lanelith Rillmaw
TEXT.Spanish: Doctor Lanelith Rillmaw

TEXT.English: Fear makes companions of all of us.
TEXT.French: Fear makes companions of all of us.
TEXT.German: Fear makes companions of all of us.
TEXT.Italian: Fear makes companions of all of us.
TEXT.Spanish: Fear makes companions of all of us.

TEXT.English: Malvacc Dimuld
TEXT.French: Malvacc Dimuld
TEXT.German: Malvacc Dimuld
TEXT.Italian: Malvacc Dimuld
TEXT.Spanish: Malvacc Dimuld

TEXT.English: Forgive me, but I can't resist the urge to give you one of my all-time favorite pieces of advice : "If you're going through hell, keep going."
TEXT.French: J'espère que vous me le pardonnerez, mais je ne peux pas résister au besoin pressant de vous offrir un de mes meilleurs conseils : « Si vous avez l'impression de vivre un enfer, ne vous arrêtez pas en si bon chemin."
TEXT.German: Forgive me, but I can't resist the urge to give you one of my all-time favorite pieces of advice : "If you're going through hell, keep going."
TEXT.Italian: Forgive me, but I can't resist the urge to give you one of my all-time favorite pieces of advice : "If you're going through hell, keep going."
TEXT.Spanish: Forgive me, but I can't resist the urge to give you one of my all-time favorite pieces of advice : "If you're going through hell, keep going."

TEXT.English: Commander Meryr Niodep
TEXT.French: Commandant Meryr Niodep
TEXT.German: Commander Meryr Niodep
TEXT.Italian: Commander Meryr Niodep
TEXT.Spanish: Commander Meryr Niodep

TEXT.English: There are all kinds of Warlords. Good ones, Bad ones, bucketfuls of them.[NEWLINE] But once in a while, one stands out. Exceptional, Heroic, Legendary.[NEWLINE]Chiefs like that, there are almost none. [NEWLINE]But do you know what they all have in common? You know what it is, their secret power ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They fight only for the dignity of the downtrodden.
TEXT.French: There are all kinds of Warlords. Good ones, Bad ones, bucketfuls of them.[NEWLINE] But once in a while, one stands out. Exceptional, Heroic, Legendary.[NEWLINE]Chiefs like that, there are almost none. [NEWLINE]But do you know what they all have in common? You know what it is, their secret power ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They fight only for the dignity of the downtrodden.
TEXT.German: There are all kinds of Warlords. Good ones, Bad ones, bucketfuls of them.[NEWLINE] But once in a while, one stands out. Exceptional, Heroic, Legendary.[NEWLINE]Chiefs like that, there are almost none. [NEWLINE]But do you know what they all have in common? You know what it is, their secret power ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They fight only for the dignity of the downtrodden.
TEXT.Italian: There are all kinds of Warlords. Good ones, Bad ones, bucketfuls of them.[NEWLINE] But once in a while, one stands out. Exceptional, Heroic, Legendary.[NEWLINE]Chiefs like that, there are almost none. [NEWLINE]But do you know what they all have in common? You know what it is, their secret power ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They fight only for the dignity of the downtrodden.
TEXT.Spanish: There are all kinds of Warlords. Good ones, Bad ones, bucketfuls of them.[NEWLINE] But once in a while, one stands out. Exceptional, Heroic, Legendary.[NEWLINE]Chiefs like that, there are almost none. [NEWLINE]But do you know what they all have in common? You know what it is, their secret power ?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They fight only for the dignity of the downtrodden.

TEXT.English: Sammael Ich Liwilk
TEXT.French: Sammael Ich Liwilk
TEXT.German: Sammael Ich Liwilk
TEXT.Italian: Sammael Ich Liwilk
TEXT.Spanish: Sammael Ich Liwilk

TEXT.English: You spent your life in the army. I spent mine in prison. Two places where a man's word is only as good as his uniform. Now out here, it's supposed to be different. And in my clan, it will be.
TEXT.French: You spent your life in the army. I spent mine in prison. Two places where a man's word is only as good as his uniform. Now out here, it's supposed to be different. And in my clan, it will be.
TEXT.German: You spent your life in the army. I spent mine in prison. Two places where a man's word is only as good as his uniform. Now out here, it's supposed to be different. And in my clan, it will be.
TEXT.Italian: You spent your life in the army. I spent mine in prison. Two places where a man's word is only as good as his uniform. Now out here, it's supposed to be different. And in my clan, it will be.
TEXT.Spanish: You spent your life in the army. I spent mine in prison. Two places where a man's word is only as good as his uniform. Now out here, it's supposed to be different. And in my clan, it will be.

TEXT.English: Malohin
TEXT.French: Malohin
TEXT.German: Malohin
TEXT.Italian: Malohin
TEXT.Spanish: Malohin

TEXT.English: All that is gold does not glitter,[NEWLINE]Not all those who wander are lost;[NEWLINE]The old that is strong does not wither,[NEWLINE]Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
TEXT.French: Tout ce qui est or ne brille pas,[NEWLINE]Ceux qui errent ne sont pas tous perdus,[NEWLINE]Ce qui est vieux et solide ne dépérit pas,[NEWLINE]Les racines profondes ne sont pas atteintes par le gel.
TEXT.German: All that is gold does not glitter,[NEWLINE]Not all those who wander are lost;[NEWLINE]The old that is strong does not wither,[NEWLINE]Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
TEXT.Italian: All that is gold does not glitter,[NEWLINE]Not all those who wander are lost;[NEWLINE]The old that is strong does not wither,[NEWLINE]Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
TEXT.Spanish: All that is gold does not glitter,[NEWLINE]Not all those who wander are lost;[NEWLINE]The old that is strong does not wither,[NEWLINE]Deep roots are not reached by the frost.

TEXT.English: Direlc Cnadek
TEXT.French: Direlc Cnadek
TEXT.German: Direlc Cnadek
TEXT.Italian: Direlc Cnadek
TEXT.Spanish: Direlc Cnadek

TEXT.English: Trust is for fools. It shifts and crumbles like sand - a poor foundation for any partnership. But mutual self-interest - now that is a solid bedrock, upon which you and I might build a new science of understanding.
TEXT.French: La confiance, c'est pour les imbéciles. Elle se déforme et s'affaisse tel un tas de sable : une bien piètre fondation pour un partenariat. Mais l'intérêt personnel ! Voilà enfin une armature solide, sur laquelle vous et moi pouvons édifier une nouvelle science de la conciliation.
TEXT.German: Trust is for fools. It shifts and crumbles like sand - a poor foundation for any partnership. But mutual self-interest - now that is a solid bedrock, upon which you and I might build a new science of understanding.
TEXT.Italian: Trust is for fools. It shifts and crumbles like sand - a poor foundation for any partnership. But mutual self-interest - now that is a solid bedrock, upon which you and I might build a new science of understanding.
TEXT.Spanish: Trust is for fools. It shifts and crumbles like sand - a poor foundation for any partnership. But mutual self-interest - now that is a solid bedrock, upon which you and I might build a new science of understanding.

TEXT.English: Donarj Vad Ksafin
TEXT.French: Donarj Vad Ksafin
TEXT.German: Donarj Vad Ksafin
TEXT.Italian: Donarj Vad Ksafin
TEXT.Spanish: Donarj Vad Ksafin

TEXT.English: Remember what we learned? To those who possess the Great Power, all things are possible.
TEXT.French: Vous rappelez-vous ce que nous avons appris ? À ceux qui sont dotés du Grand Pouvoir, rien d'impossible.
TEXT.German: Remember what we learned? To those who possess the Great Power, all things are possible.
TEXT.Italian: Remember what we learned? To those who possess the Great Power, all things are possible.
TEXT.Spanish: Remember what we learned? To those who possess the Great Power, all things are possible.
